content: In the city of Stenograd, where life was orchestrated by the all-powerful Behavioral Compliance Index, Marek Halden’s mysterious death shattered the illusion of perfect order. As the system faltered, Nikola Petrak—a council member haunted by past warnings—unearthed hidden records proving years of Council manipulation and BCI abuses. Driven by a renewed loyalty to public service, Nikola bravely released the damning evidence, sparking outrage across the city as crowds gathered to demand justice. The Council, cornered by mass assemblies at the city’s mural, faced their reckoning in public. Open lotteries replaced silent council selection, and citizens chose neighborhood managers to reclaim governance. Ultimately, the old Council conceded control, restricting the BCI to basic safety and recognizing the rise of participatory citizen councils, as hope and collective purpose returned to Stenograd’s streets.
